column4: Folks, I've just check and I have 24 second of boot delay beetween lines: "hda_codec: ALC662 rev1: BIOS auto-probing." and "EXT4-fs (sda1): re-mounted. Opts: errors=remount-ro,commit=0"
is there a way to avoud hda_codec message and save these 24 seconds?
it seems, that you arefrcing your root partition to be checked on every mount
thx for the answer, how can I avoid that.
either you have to use tunefs, either change /etc/fstab options (last two numbers)
I'm using usb stick btw and here is my /etc/fstab http://paste.ubuntu.com/513120/ I've messed with it before. Could you please have a look? Thx.
You don't mind if I ask what it does? errors=remount-ro 0       1 to errors=remount-ro 0       0
also, usb flash drives are slow in general, so you would prefer to use non-jurnaling filesystem (ext2)
it disables forced filesystem check on every mount
I've just installed maverick :/ without swap and made /var/log to be written in memory. At least I think I did that
good. anyways, you wuld prefer not to use: journalling, atime, diratime etc

if forced filesystem check in good for the usb stick, I will leave it then. How about "EXT4-fs (sda1): mounted filesystem with ordered data mode. Opts: (null)" Is ordered mode good for usb system? Also, I guess I can't change ext4 to ext2 on a working system?
unfortunately, you cannot mount ext4 as ext2. Forced filesystem check makes you waiting for bootup, while it will not find errors
So basically it should be safe without it. If it doesn't find errors I don't see the point using it. I've just changed 1 to 0 and it's the same delay. Nothing has changed.
dunno, then, it must wait for something else, but not for driver you mentioned before
Ok, thx for effort, it's really appreciated.
